00021 // StringExt
00023 class StringExt {
00024 public:
00025     constexpr static char const* WHITE_SPACES = " \r\n\f\t\v";
00026 
00027 public:
00029     // split get
00030     template<typename DelimitType>
00031     static std::string SplitGet(std::string const& input, DelimitType const& delimit, size_t index, bool ignore_repeated = false) {
00032         size_t count = 0;
00033         size_t begin = 0;
00034         size_t end = input.find_first_of(delimit);
00035         while (begin != std::string::npos) {
00036             if (end == std::string::npos) {
00037                 if (count++ == index) return input.substr(begin);
00038                 break;
00039             }
00040             else {
00041                 if (count++ == index) return input.substr(begin, end - begin);
00042                 begin = ignore_repeated ? input.find_first_not_of(delimit, end) : end + 1;
00043                 end = input.find_first_of(delimit, begin);
00044             }
00045         }
00046         return "";
00047     }
00048 
00049     template<typename DelimitType>
00050     static std::string SplitGetNext(std::string const& input, DelimitType const& delimit, size_t& offset, bool ignore_repeated = false) {
00051         size_t begin = offset;
00052         size_t end = input.find_first_of(delimit, offset);
00053         if (begin != std::string::npos) {
00054             if (end == std::string::npos) {
00055                 offset = std::string::npos;
00056                 return input.substr(begin);
00057             }
00058             else {
00059                 offset = ignore_repeated ? input.find_first_not_of(delimit, end) : end + 1;
00060                 return input.substr(begin, end - begin);
00061             }
00062         }
00063         return "";
00064     }
00065 
00066         template<typename DelimitType>
00067         static std::vector<std::string> SplitStr(std::string const& input, DelimitType const& delimit, bool ignore_repeated = false){
00068                 std::vector<std::string> out_vec;
00069                 out_vec.clear();
00070 
00071                 size_t begin = 0;
00072                 size_t end = input.find_first_of(delimit);
00073                 while(std::string::npos != begin){
00074                         if(std::string::npos == end){
00075                                 out_vec.push_back(input.substr(begin));
00076                                 break;
00077                         } else {
00078                                 out_vec.push_back(input.substr(begin, end-begin));
00079                                 begin = ignore_repeated ? input.find_first_not_of(delimit, end) : (end+1);
00080                                 end = input.find_first_of(delimit, begin);
00081                         }
00082                 }
00083                 return out_vec;
00084         }
00085 
00087     template<typename DelimitType1, typename DelimitType2>
00088     static std::string& FindAndTrimBlock(std::string& input, DelimitType1 const& begin_pattern, DelimitType2 const& end_pattern, bool ignore_repeated = false) {
00089         // find begin
00090         size_t begin = input.find_first_of(begin_pattern);
00091         if (begin == std::string::npos) return input;
00092 
00093         // find content begin
00094         size_t content = ignore_repeated ? input.find_first_not_of(begin_pattern, begin) : begin + 1;
00095         if (content == std::string::npos) return input;
00096 
00097         // find content end
00098         size_t content_end = input.find_first_of(end_pattern, content);
00099         if (content_end == std::string::npos) return input;
00100 
00101         // find end
00102         size_t end = ignore_repeated ? input.find_first_not_of(end_pattern, content_end) : content_end + 1;
00103 
00104         // erase
00105         input.erase(begin, end == std::string::npos ? end : end - begin);
00106         return input;
00107     }
00108 
00110     // replace
00111     static std::string& ReplaceInplace(std::string& src, std::string const& to_replace,
00112                                        std::string const& replace_with) {
00113         for (size_t pos = src.find(to_replace); pos != std::string::npos; pos = src.find(to_replace, pos)) {
00114             src.replace(pos, to_replace.size(), replace_with);
00115             pos += replace_with.size();
00116         }
00117         return src;
00118     }
00119 
00120     static std::string Replace(std::string const& src, std::string const& to_replace, std::string const& replace_with) {
00121         std::string tmp;
00122         size_t last = 0;
00123         size_t pos = src.find(to_replace);
00124         while (pos != std::string::npos) {
00125             tmp += src.substr(last, pos - last);
00126             tmp += replace_with;
00127             last = pos + to_replace.size();
00128             pos = src.find(to_replace, last);
00129         }
00130         tmp += src.substr(last);
00131         ;
00132         return tmp;
00133     }
00134 
00136     // strip
00137     static std::string& RemoveHeadWhitespace(std::string& input) {
00138         size_t pos = input.find_first_not_of(WHITE_SPACES);
00139 
00140         if (pos == 0) {
00141             return input;
00142         } else if (pos == std::string::npos) {
00143             input.clear();
00144         } else {
00145             input.erase(0, pos);
00146         }
00147         return input;
00148     }
00149 
00150     static std::string& RemoveTailWhitespace(std::string& input) {
00151         size_t pos = input.find_last_not_of(WHITE_SPACES);
00152 
00153         if (pos == input.size() - 1) {
00154             return input;
00155         } else if (pos == std::string::npos) {
00156             input.clear();
00157         } else {
00158             input.erase(pos + 1);
00159         }
00160         return input;
00161     }
00162 
00164     // path related
00165     static std::string GetDirName(std::string const& input) {
00166         // remove heading and tailing whitespace
00167         size_t pos1 = input.find_first_not_of(WHITE_SPACES);
00168         size_t pos2 = input.find_last_not_of(WHITE_SPACES);
00169 
00170         // remove tailing '/'
00171         while (input[pos2] == '/' && pos2 != 0) {
00172             pos2--;
00173         }
00174 
00175         // find last '/'
00176         size_t pos = input.find_last_of('/', pos2);
00177 
00178         if (pos == std::string::npos) {
00179             return std::string(".");
00180         } else if (pos == pos1) {
00181             return std::string("/");
00182         } else {
00183             return input.substr(pos1, pos - pos1);
00184         }
00185         return input;
00186     }
00187 
00188     static std::string GetBaseName(std::string const& input) {
00189         // remove heading and tailing whitespace
00190         size_t pos1 = input.find_first_not_of(WHITE_SPACES);
00191         size_t pos2 = input.find_last_not_of(WHITE_SPACES);
00192 
00193         // remove tailing '/'
00194         while (input[pos2] == '/' && pos2 != 0) pos2--;
00195 
00196         // find last '/'
00197         size_t pos = input.find_last_of('/', pos2);
00198 
00199         if (pos == std::string::npos) {
00200             return input.substr(pos1, pos2 - pos1 + 1);
00201         } else {
00202             return input.substr(pos + 1, pos2 - pos);
00203         }
00204         return input;
00205     }
00206 
00207     static std::string GetSuffix(std::string const& input) {
00208         std::string tmp = GetBaseName(input);
00209 
00210         size_t pos = tmp.find_last_of('.');
00211 
00212         if (pos == std::string::npos) {
00213             return std::string("");
00214         } else {
00215             return tmp.substr(pos + 1);
00216         }
00217         return tmp;
00218     }

00221     // hex string
00222     static std::string BinToString(void const *input, size_t inlen) {
00223         std::string tmp;
00224         for (size_t off = 0; off < inlen; off++) {
00225             unsigned char ch = *((unsigned char *)input + off);
00226             if (ch < 0x20 || ch > 0x7e)
00227                 tmp.push_back('.');
00228             else
00229                 tmp.push_back(ch);
00230         }
00231         return tmp;
00232     }
00233 
00234     static std::string BinToHexString(void const *input, size_t inlen) {
00235         static const char CHAR_TABLE[] = {'0', '1', '2', '3', '4', '5', '6', '7',
00236                                           '8', '9', 'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f'};
00237 
00238         std::string tmp;
00239         for (size_t off = 0; off < inlen; off++) {
00240             tmp.push_back(CHAR_TABLE[(*((unsigned char *)input + off) >> 4) & 0xf]);
00241             tmp.push_back(CHAR_TABLE[*((unsigned char *)input + off) & 0xf]);
00242         }
00243         return tmp;
00244     }
00245 
00246     static std::string HexStringToBin(char const *input, size_t inlen) {
00247         std::string tmp;
00248         tmp.assign(inlen / 2, ' ');
00249 
00250         for (size_t off = 0; off < inlen / 2; off++) {
00251             switch (input[off * 2]) {
00252                 case '0': tmp[off] = (0x0 << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00253                 case '1': tmp[off] = (0x1 << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00254                 case '2': tmp[off] = (0x2 << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00255                 case '3': tmp[off] = (0x3 << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00256                 case '4': tmp[off] = (0x4 << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00257                 case '5': tmp[off] = (0x5 << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00258                 case '6': tmp[off] = (0x6 << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00259                 case '7': tmp[off] = (0x7 << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00260                 case '8': tmp[off] = (0x8 << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00261                 case '9': tmp[off] = (0x9 << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00262                 case 'a': tmp[off] = (0xa << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00263                 case 'b': tmp[off] = (0xb << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00264                 case 'c': tmp[off] = (0xc << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00265                 case 'd': tmp[off] = (0xd << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00266                 case 'e': tmp[off] = (0xe << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00267                 case 'f': tmp[off] = (0xf << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00268                 case 'A': tmp[off] = (0xa << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00269                 case 'B': tmp[off] = (0xb << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00270                 case 'C': tmp[off] = (0xc << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00271                 case 'D': tmp[off] = (0xd << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00272                 case 'E': tmp[off] = (0xe << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00273                 case 'F': tmp[off] = (0xf << 4) & 0xf0; break;
00274             }
00275             switch (input[off * 2 + 1]) {
00276                 case '0': tmp[off] += 0x0; break;
00277                 case '1': tmp[off] += 0x1; break;
00278                 case '2': tmp[off] += 0x2; break;
00279                 case '3': tmp[off] += 0x3; break;
00280                 case '4': tmp[off] += 0x4; break;
00281                 case '5': tmp[off] += 0x5; break;
00282                 case '6': tmp[off] += 0x6; break;
00283                 case '7': tmp[off] += 0x7; break;
00284                 case '8': tmp[off] += 0x8; break;
00285                 case '9': tmp[off] += 0x9; break;
00286                 case 'a': tmp[off] += 0xa; break;
00287                 case 'b': tmp[off] += 0xb; break;
00288                 case 'c': tmp[off] += 0xc; break;
00289                 case 'd': tmp[off] += 0xd; break;
00290                 case 'e': tmp[off] += 0xe; break;
00291                 case 'f': tmp[off] += 0xf; break;
00292                 case 'A': tmp[off] += 0xa; break;
00293                 case 'B': tmp[off] += 0xb; break;
00294                 case 'C': tmp[off] += 0xc; break;
00295                 case 'D': tmp[off] += 0xd; break;
00296                 case 'E': tmp[off] += 0xe; break;
00297                 case 'F': tmp[off] += 0xf; break;
00298             }
00299         }
00300         return tmp;
00301     }

00303     static std::string BinToString(std::string const& input) { return BinToString(input.data(), input.size()); }
00304     static std::string BinToHexString(std::string const& input) { return BinToHexString(input.data(), input.size()); }
00305     static std::string HexStringToBin(std::string const& input) { return HexStringToBin(input.data(), input.size()); }

00308     // other
00309     static std::string Format(char const *fmt, ...) {
00310         char tmp[8192];
00311 
00312         va_list ap;
00313         va_start(ap, fmt);
00314         std::vsprintf(tmp, fmt, ap);
00315         va_end(ap);
00316 
00317         return std::string(tmp);
00318     }

00320     static size_t Utf8Length(std::string const& str) {
00321         return Utf8Length(str.c_str());
00322     }
00323 
00324     static size_t Utf8Length(char const* str) {
00325         size_t length = 0;
00326         for (size_t i = 0; i < strlen(str); ++i) {
00327             if ((str[i] & 0xc0) != 0x80) length++;
00328         }
00329         return length;
00330     }
00331 
00332     static std::istream& SafeGetLine(std::istream& is, std::string& t) {
00333         // The characters in the stream are read one-by-one using a std::streambuf.
00334         // That is faster than reading them one-by-one using the std::istream.
00335         // Code that uses streambuf this way must be guarded by a sentry object.
00336         // The sentry object performs various tasks,
00337         // such as thread synchronization and updating the stream state.
00338         t.clear();
00339         std::istream::sentry se(is, true);
00340         std::streambuf* sb = is.rdbuf();
00341 
00342         while(true) {
00343             int c = sb->sbumpc();
00344             switch (c) {
00345                 case '\n': return is;
00346                 case '\r': if(sb->sgetc() == '\n') sb->sbumpc(); return is;
00347                 case EOF : if(t.empty()) is.setstate(std::ios::eofbit); return is;
00348                 default  : t += (char)c;
00349             }
00350         }
00351     }
00352 };
